title: Wil Greenway: Either Side of Everything
description: Master storyteller and underground hit of the Fringe returns with a new show you can't see when you're dead. Sold out 2015-2017, Best Comedy Storytelling Act 2017 – What's On London Comedy Awards.

title: Games by Henry Naylor
description: Europe fracturing. Anti-Semitism rising. Right-wing populism surging. This is the timely, true story of Helene Mayer, the only Jewish athlete in the 1936 Nazi Olympic Team. Cautionary tale by three-time Fringe First winner Naylor

title: Jonny Woo's All Star Brexit Cabaret
description: Drag Superstar, Jonny Woo and Olivier Award winner, Richard Thomas (Jerry Springer The Opera) bring you this sequin-spangled musical ripped straight from the headlines. Featuring a star-studded cast of top Fringe talent.

title: Mr. Swallow and the Vanishing Elephant
description: Following the five-star, sell-out success of Houdini, Nick Mohammed's alter ego Mr. Swallow is back with another hour of magic, music and elephants.

title: One Life Stand
description: A late-night search for intimacy across a hyperconnected, hypersexualised city, from the award-winning team behind All We Ever Wanted Was Everything. Written by Eve Nicol with music by James Frewer and Honeyblood.

title: Lights Over Tesco Car Park
description: Basically: Robert reported lights over the Tesco car park. Then he told us an alien was coming to stay in his spare room. A docu-comedy. Samuel French New Play Award winner 2018.

title: Trojan Horse
description: A new documentary play by LUNG (E15, The 56 and Chilcot), Trojan Horse follows the real-life stories of Muslim teachers and governors who were accused of plotting extremism in Birmingham schools.

title: Flight
description: In the unlikely event of a sudden loss of cabin pressure, next of kin and an extra pillow will be provided. Flight takes place in a shipping container in absolute darkness, every 30 minutes. Created by Darkfield.

title: Hamilton (Lewis)
description: Hamilton (Lewis) is the story of a young, scrappy and hungry Lewis Hamilton, born and raised in Stevenage, the most successful British F1 driver in history. A brand-new musical parody, in no way endorsed by Lin-Manuel Miranda.

title: We've got each other
description: The almost entirely imagined Bon Jovi musical. Join Paul O'Donnell as he entertainingly attempts to create the spectacle of a full-scale musical (hydraulic lifts and all) with just himself, a space and 180+ lighting cues.

title: Mark Thomas - Check Up: Our NHS at 70
description: Mark Thomas uses his own demise to explore what's going wrong in our NHS, how it can go right and what the future might hold for all of us.

title: Tom Neenan: It's Always Infinity
description: A multimedia narrative-driven character comedy about Tom’s attempt to turn a search for his missing girlfriend into a piece of important 'art'.

title: Everything Not Saved
description: This show is about memory (but not nostalgia). Come see ex-lovers argue about when they were happiest, police officers accidentally rewrite history and Rasputin dance like no one's watching. It's a ritual, a sacrifice, a purge.

title: Stories and Songs With Beans on Toast
description: Cult legend Beans on Toast's debut Fringe appearance. A unique performance of love songs, protest songs and drinking songs intertwined with stories behind the songs and the random adventures they've led him on.

title: Underground Railroad Game
description: A pair of school teachers are getting down and dirty. Going round after round on the mat of American history, the duo tackles race, sex and power politics in this R-rated, Obie Award-winning, fearless comedy.
